alert.note: Alert for Hartford; Tolland; Windham (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 18 at 2:47AM EST until December 18 at 5:22PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northern Connecticut, including the following areas, Hartford CT, Tolland CT and Windham CT, Massachusetts, including the following areas, Central Middlesex MA, Eastern Franklin MA, Eastern Hampden MA, Eastern Hampshire MA, Northern Bristol MA, Northern Middlesex MA, Northern Worcester MA, Southern Worcester MA, Western Franklin MA, Western Hampden MA, Western Hampshire MA and Western Norfolk MA, and northern Rhode Island, including the following areas, Eastern Kent RI, Northwest Providence RI, Southeast Providence RI and Western Kent RI. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Storm total rainfall of two to four inches will result in rapid stream and small river rises. Areas of urban and poor drainage street flooding are likely as well. Given similar rain totals fell just a week ago, soils remain saturated and rivers remain swollen, yielding the potential for renewed flooding risks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
